turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sandy? ...Sandy, please.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: I'll get a coat for her.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Mike's gotta go.  Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, nice meetin' yuh.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are watchin' this junk for?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You can change it if you want to.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know why we have to watch T.V.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Mike. We don't have to watch it. Come on.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Sandy?. Could I talk to you a minute?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Sure. just a sec.  Excuse me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Come on out a minute, okay?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey come here, you stole my girl, you bastard. I'm gonna kick your ass, right in front of your stupid house.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: ... Stop it Mike.

turns.speaker: ALESSANDRO
turns.text: QUIET!  Callate!  Where's Diego?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know.  He sent me.  I'm George.

turns.speaker: ALESSANDRO
turns.text: Oh, I see.  George.  Well, that explains everything.  Open your mouth, George.

turns.speaker: ALESSANDRO
turns.text: I've been holding this shit for him for three weeks.  You tell Diego I don't appreciate it.  You tell him I want my money by Friday.  Can you do that?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Um-hmm.

turns.speaker: ALESSANDRO
turns.text: Greetings, Mr. George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Where do you guys want to count?

turns.speaker: ALESSANDRO
turns.text: On the plane.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What plane?  We going someplace?  Where we headed?  You have your money.  It's all there.  What the fuck is going on?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Pleased to meet you finally, George.  I am Augusto Oliveras.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My pleasure, Augusto.  Diego has told me much about you.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Norman Cay is not a person.  He is an island, George.  In the Bahamas.  From what they say, it is free and it's Diego's new home.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Let us walk.  From what I understand, Diego has bought a hundred and sixty acres, a marina, a hotel, and an airstrip.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Motherfucker works fast.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: The word is that soon he is to be king of the middle empire.  He is doing multiple runs right now and using the island as a jump-off point.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He what?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Yes.  Jack Stevens is already a very busy man.  Along with many others.  You shouldn't stay away so long.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's impossible.  We can't be up and running.  Who's distributing?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No honey, I'm alright.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: A toast!  To Mister George Jung.  Mr. I 95, north and south.  My brother-in-law. Happy birthday!

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Three-hundred kilos is a very big load, Georgie.  Why don't we start small?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No.  I have the space.  I figured it out.  This is what I want to do.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Alright.  I'll ask Pablo, tell him it's for you.  I don't think there will be a problem.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Five-thousand per kilo.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Ha ha.  That's too much, Georgie.  Those days are over.  The rate is one-thousand dollars.  Inflation, you know?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: This is a one time thing, Gusto.  One and I'm out.  Give me a good price for old time's sake.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: I'm so glad you two could make it. Mirtha, look at you.  So beautiful.  You look like you're about to burst.

turns.speaker: MIRTHA
turns.text: Thanks.  I am.  Where's Martha?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: I don't know.  Drunk somewhere.  Try the bar.  And if you find her, tell her to come, it's almost midnight.

turns.speaker: MIRTHA
turns.text: Que va hacer?

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Que queres decir.  Que es lo que el va hacer?  Pues, no va hacer nada.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Blanca, por favor.

turns.speaker: MIRTHA
turns.text: Mama, vos sos bien antigua.  Como lo va a matar con un picahielo.  Eso era en su tiempo, estamos casi ya en los ochenta. El lo va a meter un tiro, lo va a volar, le va a hechar un hijueputa carro encima.

turns.speaker: AUGUSTO
turns.text: Dejen la maricada pues!  No jodan! Nadie va a matar a nadie!  George, debemos hablarle al Patron, es la unica manera, mano.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you sure this guy is cool?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You'll see for yourself.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Nothing like this back home.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Derek!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: This is it for me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What is?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just everything.  You.  California.  The beach.  This spot right here.  I feel like I belong here, you know?  It just feels right.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You happy, baby?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  I am.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you sure this guy is cool?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You'll see for yourself.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Nothing like this back home.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Derek!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: This is it for me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What is?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just everything.  You.  California.  The beach.  This spot right here.  I feel like I belong here, you know?  It just feels right.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You happy, baby?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  I am.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're gonna call it California sinsemilla.  Sounds exotic.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm telling you, Derek, it will sell.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Should we buy it?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Are you kidding?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We'll take it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Honey, your nose!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh my G-d, I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You wanna split?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Yeah, I don't feel so well.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Okay, guys, we're gonna leave.  Let's get the check.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you sure you're okay?  You're pale.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I feel like shit.  Me and my frigging nosebleeds.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm taking you to the doctor when we get home, and I don't want to hear any arguments.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Would you be bummed out if I didn't go to Chicago with you?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, not at all.  Sure.  You're right. You fly home and get some rest.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Nice first impression.  A nose bleed in front of your parents.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh my G-d, how embarrassing were they? I wanted to shoot myself.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, they weren't that bad.  I mean, they were kind of cute.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Promise me that we'll never be like them.  I don't want to wind up like that.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Relax, baby.  We're going to wind up like us.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Surprise.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Baby, you didn't have to come.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What, and miss all the fun?  C'mon, not a chance.  So, what's the verdict?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Lawyer says he can plead it down to five years.  I'll serve two.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Two years.  George, I can't wait that long.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?  You're not going to wait for me?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: George, I went to the doctor.  I don't have two years.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Which brings me to rule number three: which says, fuck rules one and two, skip bail and take off.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Tuna, this is crap.

turns.speaker: TUNA
turns.text: I know it's not the greatest.  It's commercial.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: It's garbage.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You can't sell this to your friends.

turns.speaker: TUNA
turns.text: Man.  Fuck you guys.  I have this great idea and you guys have to be all skeptical.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Look, if you really wanna score some dope, I got the guy.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Tuna, this is crap.

turns.speaker: TUNA
turns.text: I know it's not the greatest.  It's commercial.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: It's garbage.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You can't sell this to your friends.

turns.speaker: TUNA
turns.text: Man.  Fuck you guys.  I have this great idea and you guys have to be all skeptical.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Look, if you really wanna score some dope, I got the guy.

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: Mr. Jung, you're a convicted felon, correct?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes, I am.

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: Do you have any agreement or understanding whatsoever with the United States government in regards to your testimony?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, I cam here out of my own volition.

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Something about vengance being best served cold.

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: Really.  Are you getting paid, Mr. Jung?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: Mr. Jung, don't you have an agreement or understanding with the United States Government in connection with your testimony in this case?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm doing sixty years at Otisville, no chance of parole.  Even if they cut my sentence in half I'll be seventy-three years old.  That's some fucking deal.  I don't know if the parole board, the judge, the pope or Jesus Christ himself can get me out of here.  I have a really bad record, I'm not sure what's going to happen.

turns.speaker: CALIBANOS
turns.text: So you do have an agreement with the United States Government, Mr. Jung, correct?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Not so fast.  I would like to go over the details.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What details?  I put the coke in the false bottoms and take it through customs.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Tell me about the suitcases.  What is the make and the color?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Hmm.  I see.  Will there be clothes in the suitcase?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?  Yeah, sure.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Whose cloths?  Your clothes?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My clothes, your clothes.  What does it matter?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: I would like to know the contents. Every detail is important.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What are we doing here, Diego?  This guy's a clown.  He's talking about clothes.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: I demand to know everything.  I do not trust six-hundred thousand dollars of coca to someone I don't know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's a lousy fifteen kilos.  I piss fifteen kilos.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: The coca is my responsibility!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're a fucking amateur!

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Why are you speaking?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: You.  Your responsibility is over.  You do not fly.  You are not a pilot.  You are not a distributor.  You introduced us to Mr. Stevens and the use of his airplane.  That is all.  You make a percentage.  A generous one.  And you're lucky to get that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I see.  How much?

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Padrino will pay ten-thousand per kilo. For everyone.  For you, and you, and you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mirtha.

turns.speaker: CESAR
turns.text: Diego needs to see you right away, please.  Excuse us, Amorcito.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What can I do for you guys?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We want some grass.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I know what you want.  But, first of all, are you cops?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Because if you are, you have to tell me. If not, it's entrapment.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We're not cops.  We're from Massachusettes.  I mean, does he look like a cop?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I guess not.  Okay.  You know, you're very lucky you're friends of Barbie's. If you weren't, I'd never talk to you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's your grass.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: What can I do for you guys?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We want some grass.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I know what you want.  But, first of all, are you cops?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Because if you are, you have to tell me. If not, it's entrapment.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We're not cops.  We're from Massachusettes.  I mean, does he look like a cop?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I guess not.  Okay.  You know, you're very lucky you're friends of Barbie's. If you weren't, I'd never talk to you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's your grass.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The way we figure it, Barbara flies to Boston twice a week.  Two bags per flight.  Twenty-five pounds in each bag.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You're kidding, right?  That's a hundred pounds a week.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, I know, it's a lot of weight.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Here's the best part.  We can charge five-hundred a pound.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Come on, George, no one is going to pay that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's already been negotiated.  It's done.  The money is there waiting.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Goodness.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Goodness is right.  If you do the math, that's over thirty grand a week profit. I want you to be my partner on this, Derek.  Fifty-fifty.  That's fifteen thousand a week for you, my friend.  In your pocket, free and clear.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: And I only deal with you?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Barbara and me.  No one else.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You guys are such babies.  You want to go home, go.  Me, I'm not going to stop until I find the fucking motherlode.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you sure you want to do this in front of everyone?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Don't be ridiculous, these are my babies.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What did I tell you?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's great and everything, but what am I going to do with all this?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Sell it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Half a million for you.  Half a million for me.  One-point-three five for the Colombians.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Nice doing business with you, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Not bad for a weekend's work, huh?

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: It's nothing personal, George.  Just business.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  I understand.  Just business. Right.  Fuck you.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Happy Birthday, George.  Mirtha invited me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  She told me.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Look, I'm sorry about everything.  I feel like an idiot.  You were right.  I did fuck you.  And then Diego fucked me. Cut me out, too.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I heard.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: I lost sight of everything.  Forgot who my friends were.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's in the past.  I'm out of the business now, so forget about it.  No hard feelings.  We need to move on.  And besides, I'm sorry, too.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: For calling you a homo.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: That was out of line.

turns.speaker: DEREK
turns.text: Christ almighty, George.  Feed her a cheeseburger or something.  What does she weight, eighty pounds?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I know.  She needs to slow down.  She's going to blow an O-ring.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I want my kid out of protective custody. Now.  No fucking around.  My wife and my kid on a plane tonight.  I sign when they call me safe and sound.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE #1
turns.text: No fucking way.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Fuck you, then.  I sign nothing.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE #1
turns.text: George?  You better get yourself a good lawyer this time.  We're gonna nail your ass to the wall on this one.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh hey, one more thing?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE #1
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Get me a six pack.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: If you don't mind me asking, what is the reason you are in this place?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Your offense?  Why are you here?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Intriguing.  I see.  Would you like to know my crime?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Not really, no.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't like a lot of conversation, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Me, too.  Too much blah, blah, blah, blah is no good.  But we are roommates, okay?  And we must talk to each other. I am arrested for stealing cars.  For the grand theft auto.  Okay?  So, now it is your turn.  Now you will tell me, okay?  You will tell me why you are here?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Oh, come on, George.  If we are to be friends, we must trust each other.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Murder.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Ah, yes.  The murder.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What do you got there, Diego?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Nothing.  Just a little project.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What kind of project?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Never mind.  Not for you to worry.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I thought you said we were roommates. That we should talk about everything.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: You have your intrigues.  I have mine. This is a happy day for me, George. Nine months from today, I will be in Medellin sipping champagne.  In nine months, I am free.  How much time do you have?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Twenty-six months.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Twenty-six months?  For murder?  I must be your lawyer.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've got to get out of here, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Only two ways I know to leave here early.  One is to escape.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's the other one?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I never believed you were a murderer.  I knew.  I knew you are a magico.  I have seen it in you.  It's in your spirit.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm tired, Diego.  Go to bed.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: You like to make the boundaries disappear.  It's not only the money, is it, George?  The adventure is part of the victory.  It's the thrill, ah?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: In my country, I am a magico.  A man with a dream.  A man on the rise.  To take nothing and make it something, okay?  I have failed my dream, but I will accomplish.  That is why I am in your country.  Yes, I lose my freedom. But they do not take my dream.  Do you have a dream, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I would if I could get some sleep.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Yes, you have a dream.  And maybe you accomplish your dream.  But yet you failed.  Why?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Because I got caught.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: No, my brother.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Because they caught me?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: You failed because you had the wrong dream.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George?  What do you know about cocaine?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know, Diego.  I've got a good thing going already.  Everybody smokes pot.  It's easy.  Cocaine is a rich man's drug.  It's too expensive.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: No, no.  That is where you are wrong. For us, it is cheap.  In Medellin, we buy for six-thousand dollars a kilo.  IN Miami, we sell for sixty.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's over fifty-thousand dollars profit per kilo.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: And that's wholesale.  Cut it a few times and retail, you're looking at two, three-hundred thousand.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh my G-d.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Yes.  And a kilo of coca is smaller than a kilo of your precious marijuana. Everything is the same, George, except instead of thousands, you are making millions.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus Christ.  Jesus fucking Christ.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Now do you see what I am saying?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Getting it here is no problem.  Trust me.  I'll fly it in myself if I have to. What about supply?  How much can we get?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Don't worry.  We will talk of everything.  We have the time.  You arrive here with a Bachelor of Marijuana, but you will leave with a Doctorate of Cocaine.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: What type of planes do you have?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Four passenger, single engine Cessna.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: How many kilos can we fit in these planes?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know.  A hundred, hundred and fifty.  How many miles is it from Colombia to Miami?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Fifteen hundred.  We'll have to stop somewhere to refuel.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We'll refuel in the Bahamas.  I know someone there.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Great.  I love the Bahamas.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Diego Delgado, please?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Allo?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Diego?  It's George.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, hallo!  Today is the day, ah? Are you out?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, I'm out.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Congratulations, brother.  I've been waiting for you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How are we doing?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Perfect, George.  Perfect.  Everything is fine down here.  Everything is all set up.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Do we need a plane?  How does this work? When do I see you?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Slow down, George.  Slow down.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: You need to come down here, everybody meets everybody.  Ho ho ho.  Ha ha ha. We do one for good faith and then we talk about airplanes.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't go anywhere, Diego.  I'm on parole.  I can't leave the state.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: But you must.  It's the only way.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I just got released five minutes ago.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, are we gonna do this or not?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Good to see you, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Yes.  Look around you.  The sun.  The water.  The women.  It's better than Danbury, no?  Come on.  I have some friends I would like you to meet.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Fifteen kilos.  Seven and a half in each suitcase.  You receive a hundred thousand dollars upon delivery.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Please, continue.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We make the pick-up, refuel once more in the Bahamas, and fly back on Sunday with the mom and pop traffic.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: What's the matter, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What's the matter?  We're moving three hundred fucking kilos and we're making dogshit.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: A million dollars for our first run is not bad, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It is bad.  It's chump change.  We might as well be hauling suitcases across the border.  We're getting screwed.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And what happens when these guys stop paying?  Sooner or later, these guys are going to cut us out.  Then where are we?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: That's my George, always thinking.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: This is only part of the business, George.  A very small part.  Don't worry, there is so much more to do. Which reminds me, I need a favor from you.  I must go to Colombia.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What is it, George?  Because I have to get home.  I've got a parole officer waiting for me.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I need you to go to Miami.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Diego, where are you? It's been eleven days and these guys want their fucking money.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Bad news, George.  I'm in Colombia.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, you better get here fast.  I'm sitting on...

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Jesus Christ, George, I don't see you in two years, and you show up at my door with a hundred and ten pounds of cocaine?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just sell it, Derek.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Thirty-six hours.  I can't believe it. Everything is gone in thirty-six hours.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I think it's fair to say you underestimated the market there, Derek.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Touche.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But to the victor belong the spoils.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, good to see you, my brother.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What the fuck is going on?  When did you get out of jail?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Pablo used his influence.  Now, George, watch what you say.  Everybody hears everything.  A lot of things get said and done that, well, let's just say this isn't America.  Life is cheap here, you know?  No offense, but you know what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  Keep my mouth shut and let you do the talking.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Right.  Now who is the person in California?  The connection?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just a friend.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Who?  I need to know.  Ah, never mind. We'll talk about it later.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah.  You do the talking.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Three million.  I counted it twice.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: It's two-point-five, George.  I am sure.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm calling it three.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: We're half a million off.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Fuck it.  I'm not counting it again.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Weight it.  If it's sixty pounds, it's three.  If it's fifty, it's two-point five.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't give a shit.  Close enough.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Where do I put this!?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Try the back bedroom.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: There's no room.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Try the closet.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you comfortable with this?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, we've got sixty-one million dollars.  It's either here or someplace else.  We've got to put it somewhere. Unless you want to launder it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: And keep only forty-percent?  No thanks.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Then relax.  It's a federal bank. Guaranteed by the government.  And Senor Noriega has very lenient banking principles.  No questions.  No problems. All the pesados keep their money here. Even El Padrino.  What do you worry? Everyone knows we are with Escobar.  Who is going to fuck with us?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I'm married, George.  Me.  I can't believe it.  Can you believe I'm married, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're a lucky man, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I love you, my brother, do you know that?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I love you too, man.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Three years.  How long have we been in business?  Three years.  Does she get to meet your connection?  Was she good enough?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Shut up, Diego.  They're going to be here any minute.  I'm trying to concentrate.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I'm very angry with you, George.  Very angry.  You don't take me to California, but you take your bitch wife?  A woman? I understand you love her, but it was you and me who started this.  You and me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What do you need my connection for, Diego?  What are you going to do with it?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: What do I do with it?  Nothing.  It's for peace of mind.  It's for the principle.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus fucking Christ, Diego.  I ain't telling you.  It's just business.  Now, shut up.  You're driving me crazy.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I'm driving you crazy?  No.  You're driving me crazy.  We had a dream.  What happened to our dream?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Nothing.  Todo esta bien.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Everything is not alright.  I bring you in, and you slap my fucking face!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: This is not the time, Diego.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Take it easy!  Everything's okay!

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Que es lo que quieren de me, hijueputas campesinos?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Estoy bien, okay?  Everything is alright.  There's no problem.  Okay? This never happened.  No one has to know anything about this.  Diego, I want you to calmly tell them where the fucking coke is.  Do it now.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Es un Ford blanco junto a una pick-up.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Derek Foreal.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Derek Foreal.  Derek Foreal.  Derek fucking Foreal.  Alright?  The answer to all your dreams.  Are you happy now?

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, I am happy to see you.  How are you, my brother?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No more brothers, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: Of course we are brothers.  Why do you say that?   You hurt me, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You fucked me, Diego.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: I did not.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You went behind my back and you cut me out.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: No, I never.  I would not do that, George.  Never.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I talked to Foreal, Diego.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'd better kill me now, Diego, because you're a dead man.

turns.speaker: DIEGO
turns.text: George, don't be so emotional.  This is business.  Besides, I can't kill you, you are my brother.

turns.speaker: DR. BAY
turns.text: He's in tachycardia.  George, your heart is racing.  Have you been using drugs?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Coke.

turns.speaker: DR. BAY
turns.text: Cocaine?  How much?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know.  Maybe eighteen grams.

turns.speaker: DR. BAY
turns.text: In how long?  A week?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Today.

turns.speaker: DR. BAY
turns.text: Oh, Jesus, Get me a 12-lead e.k.g. and start an i.v. stat!  This man is having a heart attack.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, you know.  It's um...

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Oh, shut up, Fred.  Shut your big fat mouth.  You don't buy it all at once. It's called layaway.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, layaway.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: The boy is happy, Fred.  Don't be such a killjoy.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Surprised to see me?

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Take your boots off.  You're tan.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mexico.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Yeah.  We heard all about it.  I want you to know I'm deeply sorry about your girlfriend.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Barbara.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Yes, Barbara.  She was very pretty.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thank you.  Have you been getting the money I sent you?

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: You mean the drug money?  Yes, I got it.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: G-d, son.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Okay, Mom.  It's okay.  Where's Dad?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's a family heirloom.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: I've seen those in magazines.  They're not cheap.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mirtha comes from a very wealthy family.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Oh, I see.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Tell him I don't want to see him.  Tell him he's not welcome here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Mom.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: I just can't get over the size of that ring.  I just love it.  Fred, look at it.  Tell me you don't love that ring.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I'm just happy that George has found someone he cares for.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Yes.  Of course.  But, I'm talking about that ring.  It's something else.  Let me tell you.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Layaway shmayaway.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: That's right.  Layaway.  Something you wouldn't know anything about, you cheapskate.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Who's the cheapskate?

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: You, you big old tightwad.  He still has his communion money.  Tell him, George. Tell your father about layaway.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Yeah.  Nice.

turns.speaker: ERMINE
turns.text: Look at this credenza.  If you don't mind me asking, how much is something like that?  It's got to cost a fortune.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: So, this is the man who takes fifty kilos and makes them disappear in one day?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Actually, it was three.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: The man who gives us the airplanes.  The man from America.  The mafia.  Chicago. Boom boom.  Hollywood.  You are going to open for us the gates of Hollywood, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It would be my pleasure.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Good.  Very good.  Welcome, my friend. Welcome to my country.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: The man in the garden.  He was full of courage.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Un sapo?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Un rata - no good.  But he could have run, fled the country.  Gone to the policia.  But then his wife, his children, his parents, his friends, many people would die.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: But, never mind.  I am thinking we can do much together.  This problem with Diego, the stolen car, the jail, is very silly business.  To release him from the carcel, it causes me much inconvenience. The fifty kilos could have been a big problem.  And I don't like problems.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: With all respect, Padrino.  Diego is my partner.  I do not do business without him.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I like you, George.  You are loyal. That is good.  That is rare.  Maybe crazy.  Yes.  I can tell already.  You are like me.  I look at you and I see myself.  It's in the eyes, no, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: So, you are wanting to sell the cocaine for me in your country, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes, sir.  As much as you can give me.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: As much as I can give you?  Ha ha.  Very good.  I like that.  Come, George.  Let us drive.  We have much to talk about.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I like to come up here.  To make the decisions.  To be one with nature.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: People tell me that I am crazy.  That my business will never work in your country.  What do you think, George?
